div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2152 Selinunte, 1876 Burial: c. 300 B.C. or c. 220 (K) Contents: 16 AR, I AE Pegasi Corinth: 7 (incl. Per. V with Γ, Ι, ΑΛ, ΑΡ) Ambracia: 1 (as Ravel 176) Anactorium: 2 (1 altar and ΔΩ) Leucas: 3 (caduceus [2]; stylis [1]) Thyrrheium: 2 (ear-ring) Unc.: AE Rome: 1 quadrig. (legend incuse) Disposition: Palermo NSc 1876, p. 15 Tusa Cutroni, AIIN 1956, p. 206 This association of a quadrig. (not before c. 230 B.C.) with a group of pegasi terminating c. 300 B.C. is suspect
